Psychology_tweet_60_r$Psychology_tweet_1.text:
Finding A: Recent @username paper with @username now available online! Head tilt is an action unit imposter -- a downwards head tilt increases perceptions of dominance by mimicking the appearance cues associated with corrugator (AU4) activation.
Finding B: “More Years, Less Yawns”: #seniors report feeling much less tired than teenagers and younger adults ~ US study
Finding C: The results showed those who took the oil experienced less anxiety, difficulty and discomfort during their speech, compared to those who took a placebo.
Finding D: Patients with age-related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy or glaucoma had a 40 to 50 percent greater risk of Alzheimer's disease than those without the eye conditions, the researchers said.

Finding A: Recent @username paper with @username now available online! Head tilt is an action unit imposter -- a downwards head tilt increases perceptions of dominance by mimicking the appearance cues associated with corrugator (AU4) activation.
Finding B: “More Years, Less Yawns”: #seniors report feeling much less tired than teenagers and younger adults ~ US study
Finding C: The results showed those who took the oil experienced less anxiety, difficulty and discomfort during their speech, compared to those who took a placebo.
Finding D: Patients with age-related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy or glaucoma had a 40 to 50 percent greater risk of Alzheimer's disease than those without the eye conditions, the researchers said.

Psychology_tweet_91_r$Psychology_450_r$P.text:
Finding A: Learning a lot about sleep from @username. Naps and sleep are very important for young children to enhance emotional memory. Even more reasons for a daytime siesta.
Finding B: The dogs "checked" more often when they did not know where the reward was hidden The researchers found that the dogs did check significantly more often for the reward when they had not seen where it was placed.
Finding C: Why is it good to enter the workforce in a time of recession?
Finding D: We show that in-school music training changes the course of adolescent brain development.

Psychology_353_r$Psychology_tweet_283_p$.text:
Finding A: Allen says he believes that part of the problem may be that as popular youth grow older, they have to do increasingly extreme things in order to grab the attention of their peers and keep it.
Finding B: That is, sharing similar amounts sympathetic reactivity was sufficient to increase perceptions of similarity regardless of social context and no matter the arousal levels partners shared.
Finding C: There was also a significant effect of Spoon Weight on the perceived expensiveness of the yoghurt (F 1,34 = 4.413, P = .043, eta 2 p = .115, see Figure 1b ).
Finding D: "These findings show the need both for clinicians to pay particular attention to patients reporting experience of psychotic experience, and for greater funding for research into recognizing a psychosis subtype of suicide," he continued.

Psychology_tweet_5_r$Psychology_275_p$Ps.text:
Finding A: My first, first author paper for my PhD 💃🎉🎊 Looking at the association between psychotic experiences (PE) & suicide. PE are important risk markers for future suicidal thoughts and behaviour. In future, let's ask about them!
Finding B: The results of study 3 replicate previous results by showing that ads identified as behaviorally targeted can affect consumer self-perceptions and hence behavior.
Finding C: The researchers say that the pain associated with circumcision in very young babies is likely to be more severe during the operation and post-operatively.
Finding D: Recent and established AMD and DR were associated with allcause dementia, and risks for DR were much larger (Supplementary Table 1 ).
Psychology_tweet_5_r$Psychology_275_p$Ps.displayed_text:
Finding A: My first, first author paper for my PhD 💃🎉🎊 Looking at the association between psychotic experiences (PE) & suicide. PE are important risk markers for future suicidal thoughts and behaviour. In future, let's ask about them!
Finding B: The results of study 3 replicate previous results by showing that ads identified as behaviorally targeted can affect consumer self-perceptions and hence behavior.
Finding C: The researchers say that the pain associated with circumcision in very young babies is likely to be more severe during the operation and post-operatively.
Finding D: Recent and established AMD and DR were associated with allcause dementia, and risks for DR were much larger (Supplementary Table 1 ).

Psychology_232_p$Psychology_415_p$Psycho.text:
Finding A: and describe feelings, and our findings suggest that circumcision may somehow trigger the development of ASD in a small fraction of young boys.
Finding B: Openness to experience was associated with lower neighborhood income and employment rate, lower voting activity, higher crime rates, and higher proportion of people receiving income and disability support, whereas the reverse correlations with these neighborhood characteristics were observed for life satisfaction.
Finding C: "Given the widespread practice of non-therapeutic circumcision in infancy and childhood around the world, our findings should prompt other researchers to examine the possibility that circumcision trauma in infancy or early childhood might carry an increased risk of serious neurodevelopmental and psychological consequences."
Finding D: This demonstrates the importance of assessing disturbed sleep in the presence of other, well-established and robust risk factors for suicide.
